greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Balanced quinary (base 5) enumeration (or balanced quinary representation) of integers, write n in quinary, and then replace 3's with (-2)'s and 4's with (-1)'s.
comment: This sequence, like the balanced ternary sequence, will eventually include every integer exactly once.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..15624
program: (PARI) a(n) = subst(Pol(apply(d->if(d>2, d-5, d), digits(n, 5)), 'x), 'x, 5) \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 26 2019
results.author: _Jackson Haselhorst_, Aug 26 2019
